Their gripes include food packaging, health fads, the 1990s Australian cricket team, hors d'oeuvres and people who walk around changing rooms naked.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner chairs the comedy panel show, inviting comedian Greg Davies, presenter and adventurer Ben Fogle and journalist Janet Street-Porter to compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. programme.title: Not Going Out

One of the most complex surveillance aircrafts in the world, it is able to seek out, locate, and defend against threats - no matter how fast moving or well hidden.

programme.title: Graham Hill: Driven
programme.desc: An intimate portrait of motor racing star Graham Hill, who became the only man to win the Formula One World Championship, Indianapolis 500 and Le Mans 24-hour race - but whose reckless streak was to prove his undoing. Among those sharing their memories of the charismatic Englishman are his son Damon - who became Formula One world champion himself in 1996 - and Jackie Stewart.

programme.title: Jim Clark: The Quiet Champion
programme.desc: Profile of the two-time Formula One champion, who was killed at the height of his career. Featuring rare archive footage from family home-movies, candid interviews with the driver himself and comments by close friends, including Jackie Stewart, who reminisces about their time spent together racing when they were known as Batman and Robin.

programme.title: Prince Philip: The Plot to Make a King
programme.desc: Secret History documentary telling the inside story of the dynastic tensions that were unleashed when Princess Elizabeth, the future queen, fell in love with Prince Philip. It was felt that Philip was rough and ill-mannered - and with the Second World War still fresh in most people's minds, the royal and political elite disliked his German roots. But following the death of King George VI in 1952, the establishment feared a dynastic coup, with the Queen torn between the two sides. The documentary examines the complexities and frustrations of the royal marriage, as the monarch struggled to reconcile the love of her husband with the suspicions of her family and her government.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How the morale of the Third Reich, boosted by Germany's initial military successes, was shattered by the devastating defeat at Stalingrad, relentless Allied bombing raids and an attempt on Hitler's life. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates the story of the D-Day landings in June 1944, when the Allies launched the biggest ever amphibious invasion on the beaches of Normandy. Although both sides suffered heavy casualties, it proved to be the turning point in the war against Germany.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Nazi occupation of Holland, which began relatively peacefully with Dutch civil servants continuing to run their own country, but eventually resulted in many thousands of deaths through the attempted elimination of Jewish citizens and starvation of the non-Jewish inhabitants. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates an account of the liberation of Paris and Brussels in 1944, events which to many signified the end of the war. programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The story of the Nazi quest to establish an Aryan race, which set out to subjugate the Jewish population with decrees and laws about citizenship and escalated to the use of execution camps and the horrors of the Holocaust. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

Heading to Johannesburg, he reveals how the city has benefited from the scale of gold-mining in the area. programme.title: The British Middle Class
programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Tristram Hunt examines the social class's origins. He discovers how the backlash against the landed aristocracy began with a group of radical thinkers who craved progress and used their money from industry to begin a process of urban enlightenment. However, the growth of mass production led the newly moneyed leaders to move further away from the factories, beginning the trend for suburban living as a mark of status - though it meant the middle classes turning their back on where they came from.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Following the Radford family's botched attempt to spring David from prison, Irene drives off with Gina at gunpoint and forces the inspector to let her colleagues know she means business. If they don't give up the chase, she won't hesitate to pull the trigger. Soon, Gina finds herself alone with her enemy, and as they begin to talk, the two of them realise they understand one another better than they could possibly have imagined. However, when Irene orders the shooting of Jack Gaunt, it becomes clear Gina is still in very real danger. Meanwhile, Honey has it out with Steve, disappointed that he had sex with Amber, and accusing him of being as bad as his brother. Indeed, Phil is having his fair share of problems as Sam discovers that his New Year's invitation followed hard on the heels of his dalliance with the prison liaison officer. Roberta Taylor, Lynda Bellingham, Lisa Maxwell and Scott Maslen star.

Tricia ends up becoming everybody's confidante, and Jodie is rushed to hospital after she collapses at Mickie's house. Connie discovers her condition is caused by a disastrous old operation, and ends up having to remove her lung. The tense situation is complicated further when it emerges Jodie and Will have a history together.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jack has a crisis of confidence when a patient arrives in the department and leaves Charlie to pick up the pieces. Meanwhile, a teenage girl samples drugs with an older man.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Staff shortages cause tension in CPU, with Ramani bearing the brunt as she struggles to cope with an increased workload - and when an outside source brings the matter to Adam's attention, the situation becomes hugely political, only serving to aggravate the already volatile relationship between Jack and Neil. By way of an immediate solution, Jack assigns Terry to help Ramani with the case of a man suspected of being a paedophile - but Ramani is worried about Terry's ability to deal with such a task given his own traumatic background. Meanwhile, the rest of the relief let their hair down at Lance's stag party - but when the guest of honour nips outside for a breath of fresh air, he is suddenly attacked from behind by a group who put a bag over his head and bundle him into the back of a van. It could just be a stag night prank - or it could be something more serious. Guest starring Annabelle Apsion and Colm O'Maonlai.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mandy tries to persuade Mark to let her stay in the squat. Ian's dishonesty catches up with him, while Arthur plays detective to track down his garden gnome.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Two birthdays in the Fowler family; Pete is the life and soul of Martin's party, but will an unwelcome guest ruin Michelle's?.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A window cleaner gets his arm trapped in a cradle mechanism at the top of a tower block, and Sicknote is sent over the edge to rescue him.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A romantic weekend in the country turns sour for Charlotte and Lovejoy when one of her friends takes a shine to him. Matters deteriorate further for the dodgy dealer when he learns Charlie is trying to evict his business. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane, Caroline Langrishe and Malcolm Tierney.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim experiences complications while conducting an investigation into the disappearance of a financier. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Lilo Lill turns up on the doorstep, Joey meets Roxy, Adrian buys something really stupid and Aveline is insulted by a photographer.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: The staff try to stop Ted celebrating his birthday every two weeks in a bid to con gifts and free drinks out of gullible holiday-makers. Meanwhile, there may be trouble ahead when the runner-up in the Holiday Princess competition is spotted entering a staff chalet at night. Comedy, starring Paul Shane and Su Pollard.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: The announcement of Jean and Lionel's wedding date gives the neighbourhood women the perfect opportunity to go shopping for new outfits - until the bride-to-be is accused of shoplifting. Comedy, with Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Lenny hears a voice from above, and decides he must wait patiently for more information, leaving the gang to make sure he is well-equipped to receive messages. Comedian Bobby Ball returns as the gullible pickle factory worker, with Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The sleuth tries to help a road rage victim, but lands right in the middle of a family tragedy she may be unable to control. Hetty tries to fix the missing pieces of the puzzle into place and her client gets a very unexpected result.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Part one of two. After two pop singers are electrocuted while performing on a TV music show, Peregrine's impartiality is tested when an old boyfriend is named as the lead suspect in the case. Geraldine Hakewill stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad is ordered by its new boss to look into the unsolved murder of a barrister found bound and gagged in his car 25 years ago. The case was a rare failure for a former chief inspector, although his notes point to a very clear suspect. As they uncover the late advocate's unusual hobbies, they gradually learn exactly what happened. Anita Dobson, Jenny Agutter and Keith Barron guest star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: An informant is due to give evidence against his former boss, one of Glasgow's most powerful gang leaders - but police fail to get the witness to court. Drama, with Mark McManus, Blythe Duff and James MacPherson. Co-star Gray O'Brien makes one of six appearances in the series, years before playing Tony Gordon in Coronation Street. More recently he popped up in The Loch, and Shakespeare & Hathaway: Private Investigators. Director Richard Holthouse went on to helm several episodes of Midsomer Murders.

programme.desc: Eleanor's absence is sorely felt, leaving Robert to take on a young woman who hopes to be a medical student, although Dr Marsham is far from impressed.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Lieutenant Colonel Philip Drysdale, the new CO, arrives with his traditional views on army life and is unimpressed the attitude of B Company's men.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Jess goes in for a routine scan, which exposes how many weeks pregnant she is. When she begins bleeding, Mubbs is forced to reveal this information in surgery - which in turn proves that Sean cannot be the father. Mark considers resuming his relationship with Tricia, although Chrissie isn't sure it's a wise move. Mickie pressures Jodie for the truth, and the resulting revelation prompts Will to consider resigning, until an incident involving a patient convinces him otherwise - but Jodie is still plotting revenge.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A wife and her mother-in-law fall out, and one is badly burned in the ensuing fracas. A bisexual man, now living with his girlfriend, is stalked by a male former lover - who he runs over. Meanwhile, relatives of the woman wrongly declared as dead complain to Elliot, and both Jack and Charlie have to make statements.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Lance is missing on his wedding day, as triends try to 'cure' him of his homosexuality. Terry tries to prove his suspicions that brother Ben is a child abuser, while no-nonsense new DC Jo Masters arrives at Sun Hill to defuse the tension between Jack and Neil - but proves to be their worst nightmare.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mandy hassles Pete to get a job, and Dot makes a shocking discovery. Grant disappears, leaving Phil and Sharon alone in the Queen Vic to face an uninvited midnight visitor.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Dot tries to talk to Mark about Arthur's friendship with Mrs Hewitt. Rachel puts a spanner in Frank's plans to relocate PatCabs, and Sharon and Phil are still alone in the Vicc.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Fresh young recruit Kate Stevens joins the team and makes a great impression by saving a child involved in an accident involving two cars and a chemical lorry.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Charlotte buys an 18th-century portrait at auction, but on returning home is attacked by a robber, who steals the prestigious item. Looking out the window, she sees Lovejoy's pick-up speeding away. When quizzed, the dealer finds the events of that night difficult to recall as he had been seriously inebriated. Ian McShane and Caroline Langrishe star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim enters the world of secret handshakes and rolled-up trouser legs to investigate the mystery surrounding a disastrous Masonic initiation ceremony. However, as he probes the case, his relationship with Susan begins to show signs of strain. Drama, starring John Nettles and Louise Jameson.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Aveline is admitted to hospital and Adrian becomes a gardener to an unusual and overpowering lady. When he quits, Jack decides to take up her special offer.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Resident Punch and Judy man Mr Partridge cons good-natured Jeffrey into funding one of his infamous drunken binges. Holiday camp capers, starring Simon Cadell, Leslie Dwyer, Paul Shane and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel gets cold feet as the wedding approaches, while Jean tries to remain calm despite her sister-in-law's interference. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Oh Look! Mitzi's Found Her Mummy
programme.desc: Clegg takes care of a friendly dog for the day, but when Truly, Billy and Alvin visit, the canine ferociously guards his new minder's house, leaving the gang to spend a day on the doorstep thinking up ambitious plans to negotiate their entry. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Lynley returns to his ancestral home to celebrate his engagement, but 20 years of anger over his mother's indiscretion with a doctor makes the occasion unpleasant. A murder in a nearby village provides him with a temporary distraction - until mounting evidence appears to suggest his brother is implicated. Mystery drama, starring Nathaniel Parker.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The unsolved-crime squad reopens the case of an Asian woman who was attacked eight years ago, and has been in a coma ever since. After enlisting the aid of a community liaison officer, it becomes apparent there is conflict in the victim's family, as well as a possible connection with the disappearance of a private detective. Nina Wadia, Keith Allen and Navin Chowdhry guest star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The strange activities of a religious cult prompt Jardine and Reid to investigate a series of murders committed by a killer obsessed with the biblical plagues of Egypt. Glasgow-set detective drama, starring Blythe Duff and James MacPherson.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The arrival of strict new sergeant-major Alan Fitzpatrick causes quite a stir among the ranks, while memories of traumatic episode from Hobbs' past come flooding back during an exercise, threatening his chances of promotion. The boys persuade a reluctant Butcher to invest in a greyhound and the wives reveal their competitive side while organising a charity auction.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: The accident has left Will impaled on a scaffolding pole, with another man trapped underneath him and the rest of the structure likely to come down at any moment. Connie is called out to treat him, and realises moving either victim could cause serious injury to the other. Mickie tracks down Jodie, who claims the incident was a result of her falling unconscious at the wheel rather than a murder attempt.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Charlie and Jack are in conflict over the death of an elderly woman, and Kate is prosecuted for shoplifting. Meanwhile, a baby is stolen from the ward.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Ramani and new DC Suzie Sim join forces in a bid to find out whether Terry's brother Ben has been abusing his son, while Honey attempts to deal with an emergency at St Hugh's hospital, only to find herself staring down the barrel of a gun. Back at the station, Jack resolves to give Jo Masters the benefit of the doubt - unlike Neil, who continues to seethe over her arrival.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pete discovers the real cost of employing Mandy. Rachel is shocked by the hostile reaction from her fellow stallholders.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: There's a shock when Ian fails to return to the Square. Mark takes Mandy in hand, Kathy sorts out Rachel's problems with Tricky Dicky, and Mrs Hewitt has a surprise for Arthur.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Kevin's dad is released from prison and Kevin persuades Marion to let him stay. Meanwhile, the Blue Watch deal with a series of odd calls, including a cat stuck up a tree.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A deranged murderer with a vendetta against Lovejoy kidnaps and threatens to kill Charlotte, trying to lure the antiques dealer into a trap via a series of fiendish puzzles. Christopher Fairbank (Moxey in Auf Wiedersehen, Pet) guest stars, with Ian McShane and Caroline Langrishe.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim is assigned to take care of a supergrass's mother who is at risk of kidnap by a vengeful crime boss - but her constant stream of unreasonable demands make the job a far from pleasant experience.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Aveline has an unfortunate experience on the catwalk, Freddie and Lilo Lill have a shouting match, and Joey is blackmailed.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Former jockey Fred Quilley becomes convinced he's being hunted by a gang of crooks who once bribed him to fix a race. Classic comedy, starring Paul Shane, Felix Bowness and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy's evasive remarks suggest Judith's new romance has problems, which Jean is only too keen to help solve - with disastrous results. Bob Larbey's comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Plenty of Room in the Back
programme.desc: After concluding she needs a new means of transport, Auntie Wainwright sends Tom and Smiler on a mission to collect her new vehicle - but it doesn't quite live up to their expectations. Jean Alexander, Tom Owen and Stephen Lewis star.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: A guest at Higgins and Ruth's wedding makes repeated attempts to kill the groom, but that is just the beginning of the machinations taking place at the Newsome estate.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A voodoo priestess who predicted her own murder is found dead in the local school - and while the team thinks her prophecy has come true, Richard is more inclined to believe it is simply an old-fashioned killing. He soon discovers a link to an affair between the school priest and the wife of the headmaster - a scandal that led to a woman's disappearance years before. Caribbean crime drama, starring Ben Miller and Sara Martins, with Mona Hammond, Michael Maloney and Nicholas Farrell.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopen a 1992 abduction case when the woman who disappeared turns up alive and well, claiming she was never kidnapped in the first place. Halford suspects the apparent victim's mother of faking the incident to get her ex-husband to pay the ransom. Drama, starring Amanda Redman, James Bolam and Dennis Waterman.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Jardine and Reid probe the apparently motiveless murder of a well-to-do businessman, focusing their investigations on a shady matrimonial agency with a roster of female clients from the former Soviet Union. Glasgow-set crime drama, starring Blythe Duff and James Macpherson.

Drama, starring Derek Jacobi, Terence Hardiman, Michael Culver, Ian McNeice, Christien Anholt and Julian Glover.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The corpse of a recently married man is found hidden in an antique suit of armour - much to Lovejoy's dismay. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A property developer approaches Lady Jane's husband and offers him a business partnership, making Lovejoy suspicious. Starring Ian McShane, with guest appearances by Nicky Henson and Sherrie Hewson.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Having finally recovered from the death of his beloved Teresa, Sharpe marries Jane Gibbons. Before the honeymoon is over, he is forced to rush off and capture a fort behind French lines - and while he is away a fever outbreak threatens to cut short his new marriage. Sean Bean stars.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: The lads are forced to take a well-known British trouble-maker under their collective wing, but his presence in the hut soon leads to friction and a beating for Neville. Michael Elphick guest stars in the popular comedy drama.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Oz comes up with an unlikely get-rich-quick scheme - smuggling porn videos back to Blighty inside a dead expatriate's coffin. Unfortunately for him, an unforeseen stop-off at the crematorium ruins his plans. Jimmy Nail stars.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Part one of two. After two pop singers are electrocuted while performing on a TV music show, Peregrine's impartiality is tested when an old boyfriend is named as the lead suspect in the case. Geraldine Hakewill stars.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A death on a local farm is blamed on a Kembleford doctor through a series of poison pen letters, and Father Brown must try to find out who sent them to save his friend from the gallows. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A day out at a local hill climb track ends with one of the drivers being killed. Father Brown persists with his personal investigation, and an infuriated Sullivan resolves to put an end to his meddling for good. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.sub-title: To Die or Not to Die
programme.desc: During a performance of Hamlet, young cast member Ben Faulkner collapses and dies. Initially the detectives think Ben died of natural causes, until Mike uncovers a complex web of ego-driven dissension among the troupe and follows his nose to the real cause of death.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: After a harsh anti-immigrant law comes into force, Murdoch and Brackenreid find themselves dealing with the fallout for its enforcers and the Greek immigrants it targets.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Sam suspects a riot is in the offing when a football fan is killed. Knowing the problem will escalate as time goes by, the detective becomes determined to nip the violence in the bud, so he, Gene and Annie go undercover in a pub to catch the culprits. However, he realises the derby match that will be the focus of the conflict is the last one he went to with his dad when he was four years old.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Sam hears his mother's voice saying goodbye, and worries that doctors in 2006 are about to turn off his life support system. When a hostage situation crops up, he becomes convinced that resolving the crisis without a single casualty will cause him to wake up in his own time. However, Gene is determined to go in with all guns blazing - putting everyone's safety at risk. John Simm stars.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Customs seize a massive heroin shipment and Kavanagh agrees to prosecute the importer, a self-made man with all the trappings of success, including a yacht and a villa in Portugal. Unfortunately, he also has a staff of hired heavies who make the mistake of threatening Lizzie in a bid to get him off the hook - thus setting the scene for a bitterly personal courtroom wrangle. John Thaw and Lisa Harrow star.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry investigate the case of a missing pineapple in Hawaii.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Toodles the Witch mesmerizes Tom in a haunted castle and poses a threat to Jerry and Tuffy.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: As Fizz gets ready to travel to another dimension populated entirely by other Fizzes, Magoo turns up and thinks that Weasel has a new kitten..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean pimps his car in order to prove to Declan - a rival in love - that Bean's car is better..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Instructed to keep an eye on Gran while the rest of the Spuds visit to the doctor, Dave finds that she has escaped..

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda: The Paws of Destiny
programme.desc: Po discovers that he has been poisoned and sets off to find who is behind it, while the students follow him in secret..

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes a tour of Tobago, where he puts his own spin on some local recipes, including hand clapped rotis, dougla rum chicken, mustard fish and mango chili chow, and a bluewater breeze cocktail. He also helps Charlottesville fishermen to bring in the day's catch and takes a relaxing boat trip to the Nylon Pool.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up crispy party poppers with barbecue dipping sauce - ideal for movie nights - a breakfast burrito, aubergine curry and banana bread doughnuts. They are also joined by Prue Leith, who tucks into their mushroom wellington.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Known as the Paradise Islands, the Sporades' lush pine forests and coastlines are simply breathtaking. On Skiathos, Julia boards a fishing boat in search of a secret world of hidden coves and deserted beaches. Heading inland, she visits the hillside Monastery of Evangelistria, one of Greece's most important religious sites, before island-hopping to neighbouring Skopelos for a taste of marriage, Greek style. After trying on the island's traditional wedding dress, her trip ends at the tiny Chapel of St John.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin enjoys one of Britain's National Trails as she walks part of the Thames Path through Oxfordshire - meeting some of the people and animals who call the banks of this impressive river home. Ben Fogle is in Whitby on the North Yorkshire coast to follow one of the nation's favourite dishes - fish and chips - from sea to plate. The programme also catches up with Dales shepherdess Amanda Owen as her family celebrates dad Clive's birthday.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there is a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through 'blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts a special double elimination show, in which two more singers will be unmasked. Sharon and Kelly Osbourne are today's special guests on the panel, joining series regulars Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross and Davina McCall as they attempt to guess the identities of the six famous faces performing from behind bizarre costumes.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Ann Widdecombe, Sam Nixon and Mark Rhodes and Jimmy Carr pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: The celebrities and their professional partners perform fairy-tale routines, hoping to get a high enough score from the judges and viewers to keep them out of the bottom two. Sadly there'll be no happy ever after for Radzi Chinyanganya, who lost the skate-off last week, but while the votes are being counted there will be a routine from Disney on Ice. Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Wealthy betting shop tycoon Alun Wilmott is shot and killed during a home invasion, leaving his wife and daughter traumatised - with large amounts of cash missing from his personal safe, it is assumed he is the unlucky victim of a burglary. Vera suspects an inside job in the shape of Alun's head of private security, Ciaran Duggan, whose history of violent crime calls his reformed character into question. Can the team find the evidence to pin the crime on their prime suspect - or are they looking in the wrong place? Brenda Blethyn stars, with guest appearances from Karl Collins, Patrick Robinson and Katy Carmichael.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The Chase presenter Bradley Walsh and his son Barney return for a second series as they embark on another road trip across America together. This time, the actor and his son arrive in Ohio, where they head for Dayton - the birthplace of aviation - before the pair attend a local rodeo later that evening. Brad soon realises that they are not just there to spectate on the sport, they are also expected to take part. However, a nasty fall from an angry bull means Brad spends the rest of the night in hospital.

programme.title: Six Nations Highlights
programme.desc: England v France. Jill Douglas presents action from both teams' opening match of the championship, which came from Stade de France. The hosts were looking to get off to a winning start under new head coach Fabien Galthie, while England were aiming to build on their run to last year's World Cup final. Plus, action from Wales v Italy at Principality Stadium and Ireland v Scotland at Aviva Stadium. With analysis from Jim Hamilton, Ugo Moyne, Gareth Thomas and Gordon D'Arcy, and commentary by Miles Harrison and Nick Mullins.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Laura travels to Edinburgh to try to uncover the truth behind Andrew's wife's death, but finds more than she bargained for. Meanwhile, tensions between Tom and Katy reach breaking point as their secret threatens to surface. Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd.

programme.title: Liar

However, when a deception in her personal life comes to light, she is left with no one to turn to and resorts to dangerous methods to force Andrew's confession. But she is not alone in her mission. Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt, Ioan Gruffudd and Warren Brown.

A few years later, newspaper owner Lord Altrincham was attacked for daring to publish criticisms of the Queen, but by the mid-1970s Princess Margaret's hedonistic lifestyle was the subject of increasing press attention. But that was only the beginning. In the 1990s, the press has a field day over the breakdown of Charles and Diana's marriage, feeding on royal scandals.

programme.desc: The documentary explores how the Queen has responded in times of sadness and grief, as she faced personal tragedies and national disasters including the Aberfan disaster, the Grenfell fire, and the IRA's murder of Lord Mountbatten. The Queen also faced her so-called 'Annus Horribilis' in 1992, when family scandal, press ridicule and the catastrophic Windsor Castle fire tested her skills as monarch and mother to the limit, and, of course the death of Diana, Princess of Wales, when her slow response to the nation's grief threatened to destabilise the monarchy.

programme.desc: In the 10,000th episode, Rita is surprised when a parcel arrives containing Dennis's ashes and a note requesting she scatter them in Blackpool. Jenny books a coach and invites many of the residents to join them, but the trip is not without incident. By the end of the jaunt, lives will have changed and one resident realises the time has come to leave the cobbles for pastures new.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia arrives in the Dodecanese, a far-flung group of islands at the gateway between Europe and the East. On the largest. Rhodes, she uncovers a treasure of trove of Byzantine art and has masterclass in painting historic frescoes. Travelling inland to the mountain village of Apollona, she meets some female entrepreneurs producing an age-old superfood made from honey and sesame. Julia's trip ends with a visit to the neighbouring island of Symi where, after sampling the local shrimps, she receives a lesson in the ancient and dangerous skill of sponge diving.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Keen to unwind, Geordie and Will head to a charity boxing match at Vic's gym. However, as Matthew and Luke face off in the ring the bout takes an unexpected twist. Will wonders if he's misjudged Matthew all along and when two boys are later found near death, Will must face up to his own part in the tragedy to help uncover the truth. Meanwhile, Leonard tries to reunite the warring Chapmans, who seem determined never to see eye-to-eye again. Robson Green, Tom Brittney and Al Weaver star.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: A chance encounter gives Pete a boost, while Jenny faces fresh heartbreak and Karen attempts to make amends with her mother. David starts his new venture, but soon realises that all is not as it seems. John Thomson, James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst star in Mike Bullen's long-running comedy drama.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: The celebrities and their professional partners perform fairy-tale routines, hoping to get a high enough score from the judges and viewers to keep them out of the bottom two. Sadly there'll be no happy ever after for Radzi Chinyanganya, who lost the skate-off last week, but while the votes are being counted there will be a routine from Disney on Ice. Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Dino Dana
programme.desc: Dino Dana, a spunky eight-year-old palaeontologist in training eats, sleeps and breathes dinos. Eager to attend Fossil Day at the Royal Ontario Museum, Dana asks her neighbour Mr Hendrickson to take her.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Lady Penelope and Parker are testing out FAB2, a luxury yacht, when they receive a distress call from a nearby tanker. A Tsunami has erupted, and a massive wave is headed for the stalled tanker's location.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's dare is take to the wheel of a high-powered sports car, but can he drift it and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom visits a haunted castle where a lovely gardener raises monster plants.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: A scheming ghost inside a mirror trades places with Tom, and it's up to Jerry and Tuffy to stop him.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo mistakes Fizz for billionaire Bruce Payne, aka the superhero, Ratman. When Ratman is kidnapped, Magoo decides to save the day..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is forced to baby-sit Mrs. Wicket's Nephew on an Outward Bound day course..

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: A raging forest fire will require the special skills of all five Tracy brothers to stop.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by Cherry Healey from 10 Years Younger and chefs James Close, Maria Guseva, and Ryan and Liam Simpson-Trotman. Plus, Stefan Gates performs some explosive food experiments.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up crispy party poppers with barbecue dipping sauce - ideal for movie nights - a breakfast burrito, aubergine curry and banana bread doughnuts. They are also joined by Prue Leith, who tucks into their mushroom wellington.

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: Volunteers test two more diets - Eat Yourself Healthy, the latest spin on gut health, and The Complete Pegan Diet for Beginners, a new catchphrase combining paleo and vegan approaches. How will they rank on the leaderboard? Ranj Singh looks at the return of fibre, finding out whether it is worth jumping on the bandwagon, and Sian Williams look at the latest veg boxes on the market which use mis-shapen produce before it ends up as waste.

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Ireland v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). All the action from the opening match in the second round of fixtures, held at Aviva Stadium. Ireland prevailed 37-27 when the sides last met here in this competition en route to the Grand Slam in 2018. However, the Welsh emulated that feat last year, securing the title with a 25-7 victory over today's opponents at Principality Stadium. Gareth Anscombe kicked 20 points on that occasion to ensure former head coach Warren Gatland ended the campaign as the only man to guide a nation to three Grand Slams. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Brian O'Driscoll, Gareth Thomas and Jonny Wilkinson, pitchside reports by Martin Bayfield, and commentary from Nick Mullins, Gordon D'Arcy and Shane Williams.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking former professional boxer Tony Bellew, singer and fashion designer Kelly Osbourne and BBC Breakfast presenter Dan Walker to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. One of them will make it through to the Super Catchphrase round, where they could win £50,000 for the charity of their choice.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the semi-final of the celebrity singing contest, in which two more of the mysterious performers will be unmasked and eliminated from the contest, leaving only three to go through to next week's final round. Ken Jeong returns to the panel, joining regulars Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross and Davina McCall in trying to guess which famous faces are behind the costumes.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the penultimate round of the blind auditions in the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' will.i.am, Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Meghan Trainor seek out the nation's best vocal talent. The coveted spaces on the coaches' teams are filling up and as ever, there is a simple twist to the auditions - with the four coaches selecting their teams without being able to see them, looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone.

programme.title: The Nutty Professor (1996)
programme.desc: An obese, terminally shy professor invents a potion that transforms him into a slim, loud-mouthed charmer. His new streamlined self immediately sets out to woo the woman of his dreams - but soon starts to ride roughshod over everything he used to care about. Remake of the 1963 Jerry Lewis comedy, starring Eddie Murphy, Jada Pinkett Smith, James Coburn and Larry Miller.

programme.title: Shopping with Keith Lemon
programme.desc: Keith takes funnyman Rob Beckett to a toy store and hunts for vintage clothes with his friend and former Celebrity Juice sparring partner Fearne Cotton.

programme.title: Teach My Pet to Do That
programme.desc: A miniature horse and working cocker spaniel are taught how to shut multiple kitchen cupboard doors, and a raccoon demonstrates some of the tricks in its repertoire, including riding a bike and pushing a pram. Plus, the trainers hit the road to help a young girl scout train her pet rat Lily to do an agility course. Presented by Alexander Armstrong.
